definitions.definition: To make a non-linear physical movement.

subdefinitions.definition: To move about an axis through itself .
examples: the Earth turns
turn on the spot
subdefinitions.label_groups: intransitive , of a body, person, etc

subdefinitions.definition: To change the direction or orientation of, especially by rotation .
examples: Turn the knob clockwise.

subdefinitions.definition: To change one's direction of travel .
examples: She turned right at the corner.

subdefinitions.definition: To shape (something) symmetrically by rotating it against a stationary cutting tool , as on a lathe .
examples: She turned the table legs with care and precision.

subdefinitions.definition: To give form to; to shape or mould; to adapt.
To direct or impel (something) into a place.
examples: Add sugar and butter, then turn the mixture into a dish.
The farmer turned the cows into a field.

subdefinitions.definition: To position (something) by folding it, or using its folds.
examples: turn the bed covers; turn the pages

subdefinitions.definition: To navigate through a book or other printed material.
examples: turn to page twenty; turn through the book
I fell off my bike and turned my ankle severely.

subdefinitions.definition: Of a bowler, to make (the ball ) move sideways off the pitch when it bounces .
Of a ball, to move sideways off the pitch when it bounces.

examples: The leaves turn brown in autumn. When I asked him for the money, he turned nasty.

subdefinitions.definition: To change the color of the leaves in the autumn .
examples: The hillside behind our house isn't generally much to look at, but once all the trees turn it's gorgeous.

subdefinitions.definition: To change fundamentally; to metamorphose . ( intransitive ) To sour or spoil; to go bad. ( transitive ) To make acid or sour; to ferment; to curdle. ( transitive , fantasy ) To change (a person) into a vampire , werewolf , zombie , etc. ( intransitive , fantasy ) To transform into a vampire , werewolf , zombie , etc. ( transitive , slang , sometimes offensive ) To change the sexual orientation or gender of another person, or otherwise awaken a sexual preference.
examples: Midas made everything turn to gold.  He turned into a monster every full moon.
This milk has turned ; it smells awful.
to turn cider or wine
How long ago was he turned ?
Bruce Banner turns when he is angry: he becomes the Hulk, an incredibly powerful green monster.
Charlie turns six on September 29.
The decision turns on a single fact.

subdefinitions.definition: To rebel; to go against something formerly tolerated.
examples: The prisoners turned on the warden.

subdefinitions.definition: To change personal condition. ( professional wrestling ) To change personalities, such as from being a face (good guy) to heel (bad guy) or vice versa . ( ambitransitive ) To make or become giddy; said of the head or brain. To sicken; to nauseate. To be nauseated; said of the stomach.
examples: The sight turned my stomach.

definitions.definition: To change one's course of action; to take a new approach.

examples: They say they can turn the parts in two days.
We turned a pretty penny with that little scheme.

definitions.definition: Of a player, to go past an opposition player with the ball in one's control .
To undergo the process of turning on a lathe .
examples: Ivory turns well.

definitions.definition: To bring down the feet of a child in the womb, in order to facilitate delivery.
To invert a type of the same thickness, as a temporary substitute for any sort which is exhausted.

examples: to turn the Iliad

definitions.definition: To magically or divinely repel undead .

main_definition: To make a non-linear physical movement.
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive or transitive ) To change condition or attitude.
( reflexive ) To change one's course of action; to take a new approach.
( transitive , usually with over ) To complete.
( transitive ) To make (money); turn a profit .
( transitive , soccer ) Of a player, to go past an opposition player with the ball in one's control .
To undergo the process of turning on a lathe .
( obstetrics ) To bring down the feet of a child in the womb, in order to facilitate delivery.
( printing , dated ) To invert a type of the same thickness, as a temporary substitute for any sort which is exhausted.
( transitive , roleplaying games ) To magically or divinely repel undead .
